result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joshua T. Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11/20/17: Court orders JOC be amended to further show that the requirement for sex offender reporting is for 15 years.

records.addlTxt:
Order for Dismissal

ec: DA, Attorney Zaleski

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom conference] 
case called at 2:02pm 
Defendant Joshua T. Nelson does not appear. Attorney Steven W Zaleski does not appear. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is on the Court's calendar for the Court to address the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and whether Count #2 can be dismissed. 
ADA Teuber reports that her office did follow up with Mr. Nelson's Probation Agent and confirmed that Mr. Nelson successfully completed the Probation term and did what was required of him. The Agent reported that Mr. Nelson did very well on Probation; he always reported and he completed treatment; he was compliant with Sex Offender Registry requirements. 
Based on the successful completion, ADA Teuber Motions to Dismiss Count #2 of the Amended Information.
The Court grants the Motion to Dismiss Count #2 of the Amended Information. The Court directs ADA Teuber to submit a proposed order
recess 2:04pm. 

NEXT:  ADA Teuber is to draft a proposed order that dismisses Count #2 and closes the case; the proposed order should include a provision that if the Defense wants to be further heard, they are to contact the Court within 30 days and the case will be re-calendared

Letter from DA's Office

Court's response to 11/7/17 Letter from ADA Shock: ADA Shock I did order sex offender reporting as contained in paragraph 16 of the DPA, but for some reason the DPA is not part of the Court record. Could you pleas efile it so I can provide the correct language for the JOC as it pertains to sex offender reporting.
Letter to Judge Weston from DA's Office
Huber Notice

[MK] case called at 10:48am. 
Defendant Joshua T. Nelson in court with Attorney Steven W. Zaleski.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case is scheduled for Final Status/Scheduling Conference today and for Jury Trial next week, however ADA Shock summarizes a plea-agreement that has been reached by the parties; this agreement includes Mr. Nelson entering pleas on two amended charges and then a conviction on the misdemeanor count and entry into a deferred prosecution agreement on the felony count. 
The State files an Amended Information. 
Service of the Amended Information is admitted. The Court recites the charges and maximum penalties.  
Constitutional rights are reviewed.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance; the victim and the victim's family members are present. 
Pleas of " Guilty " are entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis is stipulated.

As to Count #1: the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Nelson guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to Count #2: the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Nelson guilty; the Court stays the Judgement for 27 months under the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

During the Count #1-Sentencing portion of the hearing the victim C.J.J. makes a statement. 

On Count #1 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Nelson on Probation for 24 months, with conditions:
--to serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber [Work Release] privileges; to commence on November 11th by 7:00pm. 
--to undergo any treatment, therapy or counseling as required by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain employment and an educational program per the Agent
--to provide a DNA sample unless one has already been provided
--to pay costs of $443; this is to be paid as a condition of Probation [the Court does not order payment through the Clerk of Courts Office because payment of costs is a requirement of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement] 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

On Count #2 the Court affirms that it is staying the Judgment for 27 monthes; the Court places the burden on the State to file a motion to dismiss before the 27 month period lapses. 
The Court requires Sex Offender Regristration per the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The Court clarifies that it is not requiring this Sex Offender Registration to be a life-long requirement. Futher if the Court and counsel are mis-reading the law in relation to the 15 year-minimum reporting period, then the Court would entertain a motion to reduce that time.  
----------------------------------------------------------------------------


Days credit for time already served given: 0 days.
The Court clarifies to Mr. Nelson that the Bond and conditions continue while Mr. Nelson is under the Deferred Prosecution Agreement. The Court reviews with Mr. Nelson the Bond-condition that he is not to have any direct or indirect contact with C.J.J. 
recess 11:40am
JA's review of RUMS

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
[Competency Hearing]

Case called at 9:04am [ma]
Defendant Joshua T. Nelson in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Defense agrees with the report.
Mr. Nelson indicates that he agrees with the report of the Doctor, that he is not competent to proceed with the hearings at this time. 
The State waives right to present additional evidence; agrees with report of Dr. Smith
The Court finds that Mr. Nelson is not competent to proceed at this time, but likely to regain competency with proper treatment. 

The Court directs Clerk to prepare standard order for treatment.
The Court cancells Jury Trial.

The Court suspends proceedings pending treatment.
Bond remains as fixed.

recess: 9:09am
cc: DA (electronically) , Attorney Svehlek (11-3-2016) /tn 11-3-2016
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on November 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on November 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Competency hearing on November 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Continuation of Motion Hearing from 9/8/16 on the Defendant's Motion To Suppress Statements: 
[MK] case called at 3:15pm. 
Defendant Joshua T. Nelson in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Det. Eric Weiss- sworn & testifies 
--direct examination by ADA Shock 
--cross examination by Attorney Svehlek
Arguments given by counsel. 
The Court denies the Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statements. 
Attorney Svehlek Motions to re-raise the issue of Competency.  Attorney Svehlek gives an offer of proof regarding her interactions with Mr. Nelson during trial preparations; Attorney Svehlek has concerns that Mr. Nelson is not able to proceed on a cognitive level.
The Court orders a Competency Examination to be conducted. The Court will reschedule the jury trial date now, though this scheduling is subject to the examination-outcome. 
Counsel agree that a one day trial length is sufficient.   
recess 3:58pm 


NEXT:  (1) Attorney Svehlek may submit a proposed order on the Suppression Motion ruling; if she does so, she is to submit it within five days on a 5-day objection basis,  (2) Competency Hearing and also FSSC on 11/8/16 at 9:00am,  (3) Jury Trial on 11/14/16 at 8:30am.
Granting ADA Shock's request to move the presently scheduled Motion Hearing on 9-20-2016 from 2:30pm to 3:00pm

[MK] case called at 3:33pm. 
Defendant Joshua T. Nelson in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Arguments given by counsel on the Shiffra/Green related Motion.
The Court denies this Motion; the request for an in-camera review of counseling records is denied.  
After a discussion with counsel regarding the need for the Court to view the video-recording as part of its consideration of the Defendant's Miranda-Goodchild Motion, the Court adjourns the hearing.  The Court intends to watch the video before the next hearing date. The State will present testimony from Detective Weiss at that hearing, however ADA Shock anticipates that it will be brief. 
The Court continues the Bond and conditions of release.
